Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery grooved vessel, the interior is lightly covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394282) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394282)
